annonstext:
Volvo Penta is famous for pioneering new and smart solutions – innovation is in our DNA. We find our energy in challenging the status quo and by always testing the limits, surpassing the old and familiar. We allow our desire for innovation to flourish and anticipate our customers’ requirements, in every area with which we work.

We aim to be the most forward thinking and customer-focused supplier of sustainable power solutions. Innovative solutions that comply with the modern, socially responsible definition of premium and both meet and exceed the demands of a 21st century marketplace.

Volvo Penta Digital & IT is a global function responsible for Digital planning and portfolio management, IT Solution Management, Digital Innovation, Information Management and Enterprise architecture.  The Digital & IT function is an active part in developing and shaping the Volvo Penta Digital business offering and IT solutions to meet current and future customer needs.

To support our business objectives, Volvo Penta is now developing the next generation E-commerce platform – where our direct Business partners around the globe conduct their e-Commerce business, both B2B towards professional customers and B2C towards owners of Volvo Penta products.

Position description

We are now looking for an IT Portfolio Manager for e-Commerce and Parts Distribution to help us take the next step in creating a world class end-to-end e-Commerce experience.

You will be the technical product owner for a portfolio of digital products - where the new e-Commerce platform is the main part. Your responsibility will be to secure that the IT solutions in your portfolio deliver the right business capabilities, features, value and technology development over the solution lifecycle.

We are working through Volvo Group internal and contracted partners for all IT deliveries, so an important part of the job is to manage supplier relations. 

You will be working in team of highly qualified digital experts within Volvo Penta Digital& IT. Together with highly engaged and driven colleagues within the global Volvo Penta organisation and the Volvo Group, you will be responsible for shaping the next generation of digital e-Commerce platforms and solutions. Solutions that aims to be world class to secure a great digital experience to Volvo Penta customers.

This position is a global functional role reporting to the Director Digital Platforms and Services at Volvo Penta Digital & IT.

The position is based at Volvo Penta headquarters in Gothenburg, Sweden. Occasional domestic and international travel is expected.

Core Responsibilities

	Own and manage all IT solutions within the e-Commerce & Parts Distribution portfolio
	Own and manage the development and operations budget for your IT solutions
	Develop strategies and product roadmaps for your IT solutions
	Manage the pipeline of strategic development activities, plan and prioritize development roadmaps, release plans and backlogs for your IT solutions
	Identify and plan for resource & competence capacity needs to support development and operations efforts
	Scout for new trends within e-Commerce (both B2B and B2C) and progressively develop the solution using new technology
	Be a trusted advisor to the different line organizations, acting as the bridge between the different Volvo Penta organizations in need of IT solutions, and the suppliers building and maintaining the IT solutions.
	Actively participate in breaking down complex business questions and opportunities into feasible end-to-end concepts, capabilities and new IT solution designs

Experience Required

We are looking for someone that has solid experience from product leadership and in-depth technical understanding of modern e-Commerce solutions. You are ready to take the next step in the journey and build a global e-Commerce platform for a very complex business environment. We believe you have:

	Experience from developing and operating e-Commerce systems
	Experience from Technical Product Ownership, preferably in a micro-services based architecture
	Experience from development in Agile Distributed SW Development Environment

Competencies & Skills

	A customer, innovation and business development oriented mind-set
	Deep interest and knowledge in modern E-Commerce Solutions, both from a usability and technical perspective
	Good interpersonal and leadership skills: ability to effectively collaborate, network and interface with a wide variety of colleagues on different levels, across functions and geographies
	Solid communication capacity with an ability to explain complex topics to different audiences
	Fluent in English, verbal & written
	Good analytical and planning skills and proven capacity to execute against targets

Minimum Education Required

Academic degree on Bachelor or Master Level in Information technology, Engineering, communication or other area relevant for this position, or equivalent knowledge acquired in other ways

In return we offer…

… An opportunity to drive the development of Volvo Penta customer offering, business processes and solutions with a true End-to-End and customer perspective together with a dedicated Global e-Commerce business team.

You will be an important part of building the continued growth and success of an exciting, market-leading company. You will work in a team with highly skilled and passionate colleagues. This will give you an opportunity for career advancement and to develop professionally and personally. You will work in close collaboration with colleagues across the globe and deliver cutting-edge solutions and services, which drive our customer satisfaction, market success, profitability and growth.

For additional information, please contact:

FIRSTNAME LASTNAME, Digital Platforms & Services, Digital & IT, Phone +  TELEPHONENO
